content.rendered:
In our AW 2019 issue, we delve into the subject of LEGACY.

The cover of Volume 18 features Rupi Kaur, who discusses how her heritage has shaped her own burgeoning legacy as a poet and performer.

The issue also includes interviews with creative director Jonathan Anderson, and the team behind Atelier Vime. We celebrate the artistic legacies of Joan Miró, Eduardo Chillida, and Fan Ho; the architecture of Carlo Scarpa’s Brion Tomb; and the design of Gio Ponti’s iconic hotel, Parco dei Principi.

In our travel pages, we encounter the wilderness of Kruger National Park, South Africa with Singita; and take in the frescos and orange groves of Palazzo Daniele in Puglia, Italy.

We further explore the theme of legacy through essays and poetry, and present an autumn fashion edit at Kettle’s Yard.
